item.title: Versionchecker tell me what you think
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“aaa801, post:29, topic:63635”]base is orignal whitescape gutted
and i dont know what teh hell ur going on about =p[/quote]

Which is based on the base everyone uses, the one originally written by winterlove:

http://moparisthebest.com/origrs2/

If you want any hope for a stable base at all try http://rscd.eggsampler.com of course to use that it would require at least a little knowledge of OOP and polymorphism.

Read full topic

item.title: Versionchecker tell me what you think
item.dc:creator: @aaa801 aaa801
item.description:
@aaa801 wrote:

ownagesbot:

Just use interfaces for things such as client version. Anyway good luck with your server, but no offence, i’m pretty damn sure your not gonna pull it off, the base needs to be crystal clean, not fugly. Just a pointer, addBits() == :’( thats what fucked my RSC server up. Addbits wouldn’t work, never did, never will. Anyway gl.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2007, 04:53:58 AM[/size][hr]you might also wana think about using mysql or something rather than some shitty internet based database that anyone can read. Also, you won’t be able to just read your incoming packets line by line, you’ll have to use some sort of reader such as a DataInputStream followed by a ByteArrayInputStream (I think it is). That allows you to iterate through the packets next bytes, ints (next unsigned 4bytes), longs (next unsigned 8bytes), shorts (next unsigned 16bits (2bytes)), and various other things including readUTF. Anyway like I said gl and try not to rip from other sources!

base is orignal whitescape gutted
and i dont know what teh hell ur going on about =p

Read full topic

item.title: Versionchecker tell me what you think
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Just use interfaces for things such as client version. Anyway good luck with your server, but no offence, i’m pretty damn sure your not gonna pull it off, the base needs to be crystal clean, not fugly. Just a pointer, addBits() == :’( thats what fucked my RSC server up. Addbits wouldn’t work, never did, never will. Anyway gl.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2007, 04:53:58 AM[/size][hr]you might also wana think about using mysql or something rather than some shitty internet based database that anyone can read. Also, you won’t be able to just read your incoming packets line by line, you’ll have to use some sort of reader such as a DataInputStream followed by a ByteArrayInputStream (I think it is). That allows you to iterate through the packets next bytes, ints (next unsigned 4bytes), longs (next unsigned 8bytes), shorts (next unsigned 16bits (2bytes)), and various other things including readUTF. Anyway like I said gl and try not to rip from other sources!

item.dc:creator: @aaa801 aaa801
item.description:
@aaa801 wrote:

[quote=“JxS, post:26, topic:63635”][quote author=aaa801 link=topic=92157.msg979437#msg979437 date=1173226368]
a server me and system79 are working on its got autoupdate

[/quote]

Sounds like a yawner. And you wouldnt want it to auto update, its annoying as hell and if you actually plan on having the server be editable. LIKE IT SHOULD. Then whats the point, everything they accomplish will be overwritten.

Theres my 2 cents.

~Jim[/quote]

point is it hasn’t got handlers for shops and stuff yet
so im making it autoupdate and when certin bet gets finished it downloads the source

item.title: Versionchecker tell me what you think
item.dc:creator: @aaa801 aaa801
item.description:
@aaa801 wrote:

RLN:

I don’t see why you’d need the versions uploaded on a website…? Why not just keep them statically inside the files, commented or something? The whole idea seems retarded.

because its in beta[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 09:13:11 AM[/size][hr][quote=“lawl, post:2, topic:63766”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=92157.msg964118#msg964118 date=1172965313]

o and if any1 has a easyer way to read a int straight from a txt file please post

Scanner s = new Scanner(new FileInputStream("pathtofile.txt"));
int i = s.nextInt();

Read more about the scanner class here http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/Scanner.html

It comes in handy.
[/quote]
guess he means from a url so you could just as easily do

Scanner s = new Scanner(new URL("http://sex/pathtofile.txt").openstream()); int i = s.nextInt(); [/quote]

thanks looks alot neater now

import java.io.*;
import java.net.*;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class VersionChecker {
public static int version = 2;

public static void main() {
try {
JavaHowTo jht = new JavaHowTo();
    jht.setColor(jht.FOREGROUND_LIGHTBLUE,jht.BACKGROUND_BLACK);
    System.out.println("Checking file versions");
System.out.println("");
System.out.println("SERVER FILES");

///////
Scanner s = new Scanner(new URL("http://scapeserver.nationvoice.com/project79a/versions/VERSIONS.txt").openStream());
int clientV = s.nextInt();
int ItemV = s.nextInt();
int ItemHandlerV = s.nextInt();
int miscV = s.nextInt();
int NPCV = s.nextInt();
int NPCHandlerV = s.nextInt();
int PlayerV = s.nextInt();
int PlayerHandlerV = s.nextInt();
int PlayerSaveV = s.nextInt();
int SaveGameHandlerV = s.nextInt();
int serverV = s.nextInt();
int JavaHowToV = s.nextInt();
int JNIJavaHowToV = s.nextInt();
int NewsDownloaderV = s.nextInt();
int VersionCheckerV = s.nextInt();
s.close();
/////////

System.out.println("client.java	version " +client.version+ " 	newest version = " +clientV);
System.out.println("Item		version " +Item.version+ " 	newest version = " +ItemV);
System.out.println("ItemHandler	version " +ItemHandler.version+ " 	newest version = " +ItemHandlerV);
System.out.println("misc		version " +misc.version+ "	 newest version = " +miscV);
System.out.println("NPC		version " +NPC.version+ "	 newest version = " +NPCV);
System.out.println("NPCHandler	version " +NPCHandler.version+ " 	newest version = " +NPCHandlerV);
System.out.println("Player		version " +Player.version+ "	 newest version = " +PlayerV);
System.out.println("PlayerHandler	version " +PlayerHandler.version+ " 	newest version = " +PlayerHandlerV);
System.out.println("PlayerSave	version " +PlayerSave.version+ " 	newest version = " +PlayerSaveV);
System.out.println("SaveGameHandler	version " +SaveGameHandler.version+ " 	newest version = " +SaveGameHandlerV);
System.out.println("server.java	version " +server.version+ "	 newest version = " +serverV);
jht.restoreColors();
jht.setColor(jht.FOREGROUND_GREEN,jht.BACKGROUND_BLACK);
System.out.println("");
System.out.println("Extra files");
System.out.println("JavaHowTo	version " +JavaHowTo.version+ " 	newest version = " +JavaHowToV);
System.out.println("JNIJavaHowTo	version " +JNIJavaHowTo.version+ " 	newest version = " +JNIJavaHowToV);
System.out.println("NewsDownloader	version " +NewsDownloader.version+ " 	newest version = " +NewsDownloaderV);
System.out.println("VersionChecker	version " +VersionChecker.version+ " 	newest version = " +VersionCheckerV);
    jht.restoreColors();
}
catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("FFS TELL AAA801");
        }
}
}

Read full topic
item.source: Versionchecker tell me what you think

item.title: Versionchecker tell me what you think
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Yes, actually, there’s a much better way of doing it. Format your page like this:

Client# Item# ItemHandler# misc# NPC# NPCHandler# Player# PlayerHandler# PlayerSave# SaveGameHandler# Server# HowTo# JNIHowTo# News# Checker#

Where each x# is the version number of that thing. Then download that line from the site ONCE (instead of 15 times) via a DataInputStream, BufferedReader, Scanner, or similar class that supports reading a line to a String. Then split(" ") the string and you get a String array with the version numbers in their proper indicies.
Thus, the ItemHandler version would be

Integer.parseInt(versionArray[2]);

Read full topic
item.source: Versionchecker tell me what you think

int i = s.nextInt();

Read more about the scanner class here http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/Scanner.html

It comes in handy.
